Questions.question: All of the following are reasons why there was a growth in global population between 1750-1900 except:
options:
Increases in food production

 Growth in communication between east and west 

 Increases in industrialization

 New forms of medicine

Questions.question: All of the following are components of fascism except:
options:
Use of violence

 Disconnection to the past 

 Sense of nationalism

 Use of fear and instability of the people for more support

Questions.question: A World's Fair is best described as:
options:
An international competition that displays only the technologies from various countries in order to compete over who has the most advanced industries

 An international exhibition that displays advanced technological innovations and social concerns

 An international exhibition that displays scientific, technological, artistic, and cultural development of the participating nations 

 An international exhibition with a host country that displays their cultural, social, and industrial prowess while not allowing other industrial powers to attend

Questions.question: This country was neutral for most of the war, but then joined the side of the Allies near the end of WWI:
options:
The Netherlands

 Russia

 Austria-Hungary

 Italy

Questions.question: One of the main outcomes of women working in the factories during WWI was that:
options:
after the war, they pushed for leaving the workplace and going back to motherhood

 after the war, they wanted to be included in who was drafted into the army

 after the war, they wanted more representation in worker's unions

 after the war, they wanted voting rights just like men

Questions.question: All of the following could be considered a part of Stalin's “Personality Cult” except:
options:
Stalin often was shown as a forceful and cruel leader, sending people to work camps 

 Stalin often appeared in a white suit in paintings or posters

 Stalin was often shown as a strong and robust leader in paintings

 Stalin was often shown with children in order to show him as being "a part of the Russian family"

Questions.question:
Use the image shown to answer the question.
According to the image shown, which of the following must be true of capitalist systems?
options:
Capitalist systems are always dominated by a large ruling upper class

 The military does not play a key role in a capitalist system

 The church exists to fool the masses into submission 

 The working classes tended not to support revolutionary movements

Questions.question:
Use the image shown to answer the question.
Which of the following people would likely have supported the publication of this image?
options:
A socialist newspaper editor

 A manager of a factory

 A rural farmer

 A local shop owner

Questions.question:
Use the image shown to answer the question.
This image most accurately describes which of the following trends in early 20th century history?
options:
The growing tendency to accept and endorse capitalism

 The transition from manual to industrial factory work throughout Europe

 The growing tendency to critique capitalism 

 The support for military control in Europe

Questions.question: This group of military personnel were in charge of regulating rubber production and quotas in the Belgian Congo:
options:
The Force Publique 

 The Janissari 

 Realpolitik

 Hessians

Questions.question: Which of the following is the best description of the Haitian Revolution?
options:
The Haitian Revolution began as a slave revolt, and ended because the United States came to help Boukman Dutty repel the French

 The Haitian Revolution began as a slave revolt led by Boukman Dutty, but soon became a civil war between the gens de couleur and the slave owners

 The Haitian Revolution began as a slave revolt, and ended with Napoleon's forces leaving Haiti due to outbreak of disease, brutal fighting, and rising costs of war 

 The Haitian Revolution is the only successful slave revolt of the period, lasting from 1820-1825

Questions.question: Which French leader doubled the size of the French empire between 1842 and 1871?
options:
Napoleon III 

 Napoleon II

 Otto von Bismarck

 King Charles X

Questions.question: The immigration checkpoint on Ellis Island in New York is a clear example of which 19th and 20th century idea?
options:
Nationalism

 Eugenics 

 Social Darwinism

 Patriotism

Questions.question: Which is the correct historical order of Bismarck's wars to establish an independent Germany?
options:
Polish Revolution, Franco-Prussian War, Austro Prussian War, Danish War

 Danish War, Polish Revolution, Franco-Prussian War, Austro-Prussian War

 Polish Revolution, Danish War, Austro-Prussian War, Franco-Prussian War 

 Polish Revolution, Austro-Prussian War, Danish War, Franco-Prussian War

Questions.question:
Use the following source to answer the question
"As the evidence of their material achievement multiplied and pervaded all aspects of life in industrializing societies, Europeans and (increasingly) Americans grew more and more conscious of the uniqueness and, they believed, the superiority of western civilization. Those involved in the colonies and intellectuals who dealt with colonial issues came to view scientific and technological achievements not only as the key attributes that set Europe off from all other civilizations, past and present, but as the most meaningful gauges by which non-western societies might be evaluated, classified, and ranked. Science and technology were often conflated as criteria for comparison, rather than treated as distinct endeavors, as they had tended to be in earlier centuries. In addition, generalized assertions of superiority or inferiority supplanted the detailed descriptions of individual tools or particular ideas which had been characteristic of earlier accounts of overseas cultures. This shift reflected a growing sense on the part of overseas observers that African and Asian peoples had little to offer Europe in techniques of production and extraction or in insights into the workings of the natural world."

Source: Adas, Michael. Machines and the Measures of Men (1989).

Which of the following is most likely implicitly true about the information in the above source?
options:
The United States joined European countries in "scientific prowess" sometime during the late 19th century 

 France and Germany particularly dominated this explosion of scientific growth in the 19th century

 Britain may have industrialized first, but the British were the last European power to apply their industrial might to colonization

 Germany was too late coming to the colonial game to establish any colonies in Africa and Asia

Questions.question:
Use the following source to answer the question
"As the evidence of their material achievement multiplied and pervaded all aspects of life in industrializing societies, Europeans and (increasingly) Americans grew more and more conscious of the uniqueness and, they believed, the superiority of western civilization. Those involved in the colonies and intellectuals who dealt with colonial issues came to view scientific and technological achievements not only as the key attributes that set Europe off from all other civilizations, past and present, but as the most meaningful gauges by which non-western societies might be evaluated, classified, and ranked. Science and technology were often conflated as criteria for comparison, rather than treated as distinct endeavors, as they had tended to be in earlier centuries. In addition, generalized assertions of superiority or inferiority supplanted the detailed descriptions of individual tools or particular ideas which had been characteristic of earlier accounts of overseas cultures. This shift reflected a growing sense on the part of overseas observers that African and Asian peoples had little to offer Europe in techniques of production and extraction or in insights into the workings of the natural world."

Source: Adas, Michael. Machines and the Measures of Men (1989).

What major shift is described throughout this secondary source?
options:
Europeans came to see themselves as more culturally advanced when compared to non-Western societies

 The United States became the world leader in technological advances

 Western colonial powers elevated the importance of technology and science in their arguments that they were the most advanced civilization in the world 

 European colonial markets allowed the colonial powers to establish massive overseas colonial empires

Questions.question:
Use the following source to answer the question
"As the evidence of their material achievement multiplied and pervaded all aspects of life in industrializing societies, Europeans and (increasingly) Americans grew more and more conscious of the uniqueness and, they believed, the superiority of western civilization. Those involved in the colonies and intellectuals who dealt with colonial issues came to view scientific and technological achievements not only as the key attributes that set Europe off from all other civilizations, past and present, but as the most meaningful gauges by which non-western societies might be evaluated, classified, and ranked. Science and technology were often conflated as criteria for comparison, rather than treated as distinct endeavors, as they had tended to be in earlier centuries. In addition, generalized assertions of superiority or inferiority supplanted the detailed descriptions of individual tools or particular ideas which had been characteristic of earlier accounts of overseas cultures. This shift reflected a growing sense on the part of overseas observers that African and Asian peoples had little to offer Europe in techniques of production and extraction or in insights into the workings of the natural world."

Source: Adas, Michael. Machines and the Measures of Men (1989).

Which major idea from our course is most closely associated with the ideas and arguments in the above source?
options:
Eugenics

 Social Darwinism 

 The Enlightenment

 Civil Right movements

Questions.question:
Use the following source to answer the question
"As the evidence of their material achievement multiplied and pervaded all aspects of life in industrializing societies, Europeans and (increasingly) Americans grew more and more conscious of the uniqueness and, they believed, the superiority of western civilization. Those involved in the colonies and intellectuals who dealt with colonial issues came to view scientific and technological achievements not only as the key attributes that set Europe off from all other civilizations, past and present, but as the most meaningful gauges by which non-western societies might be evaluated, classified, and ranked. Science and technology were often conflated as criteria for comparison, rather than treated as distinct endeavors, as they had tended to be in earlier centuries. In addition, generalized assertions of superiority or inferiority supplanted the detailed descriptions of individual tools or particular ideas which had been characteristic of earlier accounts of overseas cultures. This shift reflected a growing sense on the part of overseas observers that African and Asian peoples had little to offer Europe in techniques of production and extraction or in insights into the workings of the natural world."

Source: Adas, Michael. Machines and the Measures of Men (1989).

According to the way Europeans thought about themselves as described in the source above, not only were Europeans more technologically and scientifically more advanced that non-Western civilizations, but:
options:
Christianity was more advanced and sophisticated than non-European religions

 African and Asian communities were more advanced than Indian societies

 Non-Western societies could not offer anything new to European colonizers 

 British scientists were more advanced than German or American scientists

Questions.question:
Use the following source to answer the question
"As the evidence of their material achievement multiplied and pervaded all aspects of life in industrializing societies, Europeans and (increasingly) Americans grew more and more conscious of the uniqueness and, they believed, the superiority of western civilization. Those involved in the colonies and intellectuals who dealt with colonial issues came to view scientific and technological achievements not only as the key attributes that set Europe off from all other civilizations, past and present, but as the most meaningful gauges by which non-western societies might be evaluated, classified, and ranked. Science and technology were often conflated as criteria for comparison, rather than treated as distinct endeavors, as they had tended to be in earlier centuries. In addition, generalized assertions of superiority or inferiority supplanted the detailed descriptions of individual tools or particular ideas which had been characteristic of earlier accounts of overseas cultures. This shift reflected a growing sense on the part of overseas observers that African and Asian peoples had little to offer Europe in techniques of production and extraction or in insights into the workings of the natural world."

Source: Adas, Michael. Machines and the Measures of Men (1989).

What is the meaning of this sentence from the above source: "In addition, generalized assertions of superiority or inferiority supplanted the detailed descriptions of individual tools or particular ideas which had been characteristic of earlier accounts of overseas cultures."
options:
Europeans used to see themselves as equal to other powers around the world

 Europeans never replaced earlier ideas of specific European technologies or tools they believed to be superior with more blanket-statements of superiority·

 Europeans previously believed their technologies and ideas were more advanced than other societies, but only added blanket-statements of superiority later 

 European scientific leaders never believed European societies were more advanced than other societies around the world

Questions.question: What is a "Crisis of Abundance?
options:
When supply is low and demand is high

 When supply is high and demand is high

 When supply is high and demand is low 

 When supply is low and demand is low

Questions.question: Which market was at the center of the early phases of the Industrial Revolution in Britain?
options:
The cotton industry 

 Steam technology

 British railways

 The tobacco industry

Questions.question: Which two countries were involved in the Treaty of Tordesillas?
options:
Portugese and Spanish 

 British and French 

 French and Dutch

 Spanish and Dutch

Questions.question: All of the following were ways that Absolutist governments showed their power except
options:
through allowing regional governments to have virtual autonomy 

 through building monumental pieces of architecture

 through claiming that their power and authority derived from God

 through the development and use of professional military forces

Questions.question: An important reason for China’s rapid population increase in the 17th and 18th centuries was
options:
The introduction of new crops from the Americas 

 The introduction of European medicine helped soften the blow from disease

 A period of peace after the fall of the Mongol Empire

 A peace treaty with the growing Russian Empire

Questions.question: Divine Right of Kings refers to
options:
the theory that kings derived their power from God and held sole authority over the state 

 the theory that kings should share their power with advisers, regional governments, and series of courts

 the theory that people made a covenant with their king, and therefore the king should listen to their demands

 the theory that the king held all authority over his subjects, using solely his position as a base of authority

Questions.question: What is a vernacular language?
options:
A language that is spoken by the commoners 

 The language of the church

 The official language of trade between kingdoms

 An official language of the practice of law within a kingdom

Questions.question: The Epic of Sundiata is a perfect example of
options:
Oral poetry 

 Written history

 religious doctrine

 political treatise

Questions.question: Which branch of Islam has maintained a majority in Islamic population since the 7th century?
options:
Sunni 

 Calvinists

 Sufi

 Shi’a

Questions.question: This empire conquered Constantinople in 1453
options:
Ottoman 

 Eqyptian

 Persian

 Mongols

Questions.question: The Catalan Atlas was made in 1375, providing an extremely detailed map of Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and portions of India. Who made the Catalan Atlas?
options:
Majorcan Cartographic School 

 Henry the Navigator
